properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 12 at 2:47PM EST until February 16 at 12:04PM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio...
West Virginia...

Ohio River At Point Pleasant affecting Gallia and Mason Counties.

...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio...
Kentucky...West Virginia...

Ohio River At Ashland affecting Greenup and Boyd counties in
Kentucky.

Ohio River at Ashland affecting Lawrence County Ohio.


For the Ohio River...Minor flooding is forecast.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Ohio River At Point Pleasant.
* Until Sunday afternoon.
* At 2:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 39.8 feet.
* Flood stage is 40.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late
this afternoon to a crest of 43.1 feet early Saturday morning. It
will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning.
* Impact...At 43.0 feet, Ohio Route 7 at Kyger Creek and Addison is
flooded.
* Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 43.1
feet on 03/25/1912.
properties.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive
cars through flooded areas.

Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may
also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using
the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.

Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.

Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx.

The next statement will be issued late tonight at 245 AM EST.

NWSheadline: The Flood Warning is now in effect until early Sunday afternoon
